Welcome to Project 3’s documentation!¶

class scripts.NN.NeuralNetwork(input_layer_size, hidden_layer_size, output_layer_size, seed=0)¶

Bases: object

Represents a neural network containing an input layer, a hidden layer, and an output layer.

seed¶

Seed for random number generation. Used for reproducibility. Optional. Default is 0.

Type

int

input_layer¶

The input layer of the network, where each element represents a node in the layer.

Type

np.array of ints

hidden_layer¶

The hidden layer of the network, where each element represents a node in the layer.

Type

np.array of ints

output_layer¶

The output layer of the network, where each element represents a node in the layer.

Type

np.array of ints

weights1¶

Weights between the input layer and the hidden layer.

Type

np.array of floats

weights2¶

Weights between the hidden layer and the output layer.

Type

np.array of floats

biases1¶

Biases between the input layer and the hidden layer.

Type

np.array of floats

biases2¶

Biases between the hidden layer and the output layer.

Type

np.array of floats

epoch_losses¶

Average loss per epoch during training.

Type

np.array of floats

train(input_values, output_values, batch_size=10, num_epochs=1000, learning_rate=0.1, loss_threshold=1e-11)¶

Trains the NeuralNetwork using data with input data and corresponding output data using batched gradient descent.

Parameters

  • input_values (np.array of ints) – Values for input data.

  • output_values (np.array of ints) – Values for output data.

  • batch_size (int) – Number of samples to be used in each batch of training. Optional. Default is 10.

  • num_epochs (int) – Number of epochs for training. Optional. Default is 1000.

  • learning_rate (float) – Learning rate for training. Optional. Default is 0.00000000001.

  • loss_threshold (float or int) – Loss threshold for stopping gradient descent. If loss is below this AND loss is no longer decreasing, training stops and it is assumed that reasonable convergence is reached in the learned parameters. Optional. Default is 0.001.

predict(input_values)¶

Given a set of input values, predicts output values using a trained NeuralNetwork.

Parameters

input_values (np.array of ints) – Values for input data.

Returns

predictions – Predictions based on input data (this is equivalent to the output layer).

Return type

np.array of ints

scripts.NN.encode(seqs)¶

Encodes DNA sequences into a binary sequences using one hot encoding.

Parameters

seq (np.array of str) – DNA sequences to be encoded.

Returns

bin_seqs – Binary encoding of sequences.

Return type

np.array of ints

scripts.NN.read_fasta(fasta_file)¶

Reads in fasta file and returns sequences.

Parameters

fasta_file (str) – Name of file.

Returns

seqs – Sequences from fasta file.

Return type

np.array of str

scripts.NN.sample_subseqs(seqs, k, n, exclude=array([], dtype=float64), seed=0)¶

Randomly subsample subsequences from an array of sequences.

Parameters

  • seqs (np.array) – Sequences to be subsampled from.

  • k (int) – Length of each subsequence.

  • n (int) – Number of subsequences.

  • = np.array of str (exclude) – Sequences that should be excluded from consideration as an outputted subsequence. Optional. Default is empty string.

  • seed (int) – Seed for random number generation. Used for reproducibility. Optional. Default is an empty array.

Returns

subseqs – Subsequences.

Return type

np.array of str
